# Seville Heritage Park

The Seville Heritage Park was once a Ta√≠no village, 16th-century Spanish colonial settlement and a 17th-century British plantation, located in what is now Saint Ann Parish, Jamaica.
Site description
The Heritage Park consists of  of land on the northern coast of Jamaica. Prominent features of the park include:
# Governor's Castle
# Spanish Sugar Mill
# Artesian Workshop
# Spanish Settlement of Sevilla La Nueva
# Spanish Church
# British Great House
World Heritage Status
This site was added to the UNESCO World Heritage Tentative List on March 2, 2009, in the Cultural category.
